Items.Title: Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation

Communication from the Mayor  -  "AN ACT to amend the tax law, chapter 877 of the laws of 1975, chapter 880 of the laws of 1975, chapter 884 of the laws of 1975 and chapter 882 of the laws of 1977, all relating to the imposition of certain taxes in the city of New York, and to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to postponing expiration dates applicable  to certain taxes imposed by the city of New York (Part A); to amend the tax law, in  relation  to  the  imposition  and  rate  of personal  income taxes (Part B); to amend the tax law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to amending  certain definitions,  modifying the measure of consideration in certain transfers of controlling economic interests in real property, under the New York city real property transfer tax (Part C);  to  amend  the  local finance  law, in relation to the issuance of bonds or notes with variable rates of interest (Part D); to amend the administrative  code  of the city of New York, in relation to setting interest rates for under payments of city income and excise taxes (Part E); to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing an amnesty  program  authorizing  the  waiver  of  certain  penalties and certain interest with respect to the payment of  certain  overdue  tax liabilities  and  barring any civil, administrative or criminal action or proceeding relating thereto and establishing a hotel room occupancy tax amnesty program for small hotels authorizing the waiver of certain overdue tax liabilities and interest and penalties thereon  (Part F); to  amend  the real property tax law, in relation to allowing an additional tax on certain class one properties in any city  with  a  population  of  one million or more (Part G); to amend the tax law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to postponing the expiration of certain tax rates and taxes in the city of New  York (Part H); to authorize the public sale of taxicab licenses in the city of  New York (Part I); to amend the tax law, in relation to increasing the sales tax in cities with a population of one million or more;  and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon the expiration there of (Part J); to amend the education law, in relation to aid for teachers  of tomorrow recruitment and retention program and to amend part K of chapter 93 of the laws of 2002 amending the education law  relating to aid for teachers of tomorrow recruitment and retention program, and providing  for  the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof, in relation to the effectiveness thereof (Part K); to amend the public authorities law, in relation to indebtedness of the Battery Park  city authority  and  providing  for  the  repeal of certain provisions upon expiration thereof (Part L); in relation to providing aid  to  certain cities  (Part M); to amend the tax law, in relation to taxes in a city with a population of one million or more and to amend the  administrative  code  of  the  city  of New York, in relation to related members expense and income exclusions and add backs (Part N);  to  amend  the public  authorities law, in relation to bonds of the state of New York municipal bond bank agency (Part O); in relation to providing for  the continuation  of  the municipal assistance corporation for the city of New York (Part P); in relation to providing aid to the city of Buffalo (Part Q); to amend the tax law, in relation to the imposition  of  tax on  individuals  (Part  R);  to  amend  the  tax  law,  in relation to exemptions from sales and compensating use taxes for certain  clothing and  footwear (Part S); to amend the tax law, in relation to estimated tax on the sale or transfer of real property by nonresidents (Part T); to amend the alcoholic beverage control law, in relation to sales  for off-premises  consumption  (Part  U);  to amend the public authorities law, in relation to payments made to the city of New York (Part V); to amend the tax law and the  state  finance  law,  in  relation  to  the disbursement  of revenue from and the conduct of video lottery; and to repeal part E3 of a chapter of the laws of 2003, amending the  general business  law and other laws relating to implementing the state fiscal plan for the 2003-2004 state fiscal year, as proposed  in  legislative bill numbers S.1406-B and A.2106-B and paragraph 5 of subdivision a of section 1612  of  the tax law relating thereto (Part W); to amend the tax law, in relation to related members expense and income  exclusions and  add  backs and repealing certain provisions of such law relating thereto (Part X); to amend  the  state  finance  law  and  the  mental hygiene law, in relation to the problem and compulsive gambling education, prevention and treatment fund (Part Y); to amend the tax law, in relation  to  taxes  imposed  on native American nation or tribe lands(Part Z); to amend the tax law, in relation to entire  net  income  in the  case  of an attorney-in-fact (Part ZZ); to amend a chapter of the laws of 2003, amending the general business law and other laws  relating  to  implementing  the  state  fiscal plan for the 2003-2004 state fiscal year, as proposed in  legislative  bill  numbers  S.1406-B  and A.2106-B, in  relation  to making technical corrections thereto (PartA1); to amend a chapter of the laws  of  2003,  amending  the  general business  law and other laws relating to implementing the state fiscal plan for the 2003-2004 state fiscal year, as proposed  in  legislative bill  numbers  S.1406-B and A.2106-B, in relation to making technical corrections thereto (Part B1); to amend chapter 174  of  the  laws  of 1968  constituting  the  New  York state urban development corporation act, in relation to making certain technical corrections (Part C1); to amend the racing, pari-mutuel wagering and breeding law,  in  relation to approval of plans of corporation or association (Part D1); to amend the  environmental conservation law, in relation to waste tire management and recycling (Part E1); to make monies available to  the financial  assistance  to  business  dry  cleaner  program for eligible dry cleaner  businesses  in certain counties (Part F1); to amend a chapter of the laws of 2003, amending the general business law and other  laws relating to implementing the state fiscal plan for the 2003-2004 state fiscal  year, as proposed in legislative bill numbers S. 1406-B and A.2106-B, in relation to services and expenses of existing family  preservation  centers  (Part  G1); to amend a chapter of the laws of 2003, amending the general business law and other laws  relating  to  implementing  the state fiscal plan for the 2003-2004 state fiscal year, as proposed in legislative bill numbers S.1406-B and A.2106-B,  in relation  to  an  equipment  loan  fund for the disabled (Part H1); to amend a chapter of the laws of 2003, amending the general business law and other laws relating to implementing the state fiscal plan for  the 2003-2004 state  fiscal year, as proposed in legislative bill numbers S.1406-B and A.2106-B, in relation  to  making  technical  corrections thereto  (Part  I1);  to amend the social services law, in relation to certain payments for medical assistance (Part J1); to amend the public health law, in relation to general  hospital  inpatient  reimbursement and  tobacco control and insurance initiatives pool distribution (Part K1); to amend the public health law, in relation to  patient services payments  and  audit reports; to amend chapter 462 of the laws of 1996 relating to establishing a quality incentive program, in  relation  to making technical corrections thereto; and to repeal section 48 of part O2 of a chapter of the laws of 2003, amending the general business law and  other laws relating to implementing the state fiscal plan for the 2003-2004 state fiscal year, as proposed in legislative bill numbers S.1406-B and A.2106-B, relating to implementing language qualifying appropriations made by a chapter of the laws of 2003 enacting the health and mental hygiene budget (Part L1); to amend the public health law,  in  relation to health care initiatives pool distributions (Part M1); and to amend the mental hygiene law, in relation to the community mental health support and workforce investment program (Part N1)". S.4968 / A.8388
Items.MatterName: AN ACT to amend the tax law, S.4968 / A.8388

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Transportation

Resolution calling on New York State Governor George Pataki and the New York State Legislature to restructure the Board of Directors of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to include voting members representing the riding public and labor.
Items.MatterName: Restructure the Bd of Directors of the MTA to include voting members representing the riding public and labor.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the enactment of New York State Senate bill, S.1008, that would establish a Metropolitan Transportation Authority operating oversight committee which would be responsible for reviewing all financial records and operating budget proposals of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority.
Items.MatterName: Establish an MTA operating oversight committee.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the legislature and the Governor of the State of New York to enact legislation preventing the Metropolitan Transportation Authority from authorizing any future fare increase until the Comptroller of the State of New York reviews its financial plan to determine whether a fare increase is reasonable or necessary.
Items.MatterName: Preventing the MTA from authorizing any future fare increase until the Comptroller of the NYS reviews its financial plan.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor of the State of New York to direct the Metropolitan Transportation Authority board to rescind its approval of the recent transit fare increase.
Items.MatterName: Direct the MTA board to rescind its approval of the recent transit fare increase.

Items.Title: General Orders Calendar
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the displaying of the POW/MIA flag
Items.MatterName: POW/MIA Flag Displaying

General Discussion

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Golden, S.3993, "AN ACT to authorize James J. Smith, a member of the New York city police pension fund, to buy back certain service credit".
Items.MatterName: Authorize James J. Smith, a member of the NYC police pension fund, to buy back certain service credit (S.3993)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Golden, S.3992, "AN ACT to allow Kevin P. McGuire to buy back certain time with the cultural institutions retirement system".
Items.MatterName: Allow Kevin P. McGuire to buy back certain time with the cultural institutions retirement system (S.3992)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senators Golden, Maltese, Marchi, Mendez, Padavan and Velella, S.4186, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to loans to members of the New York city fire department pension fund".
Items.MatterName: Loans to members of the NYC fire department pension fund (S.4186)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Padavan, Maltese, Marchi and Mendez, S.1475, and Assembly Members Abbate, Colton, Cymbrowitz, Pheffer, Seddio and Weisenberg, et al, A.3156, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the employment of retired New York city police personnel".
Items.MatterName: Employment of retired NYC police personnel (S.1475, A.3156)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Marchi, S.2235, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of t he city of New York, in relation to establishing a variable supplements fund for members of the New York city employees' retirement system".
Items.MatterName: Establishing a variable supplements fund for members of the NYC employees retirement system (S.2235)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.4124, and Committee on Rules, A.7919, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to benefits for certain peace officers in the city of New York who are injured in the performance of their duties".
Items.MatterName: Benefits for certain peace officers in the city of New York who are injured in the performance of their duties (S.4124, A.7919)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Golden, Maltese, Marchi, Mendez and Velella, S.3967, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.6797, "AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to special accidental death benefits payable to the dependents of deceased police and fire members".
Items.MatterName: Special accidental death benefits payable to the dependents of deceased police and fire members (S.3967, A.6797)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Robach, S.2980, and Assembly Members Abbate and Klein, A.6802-A, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed as water supply police; and to amend the retirement and social security law and the general municipal law, in relation to benefits for such members who are injured in the performance of their duties".
Items.MatterName: Establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the NYC employees' retirement system employed as water supply police (S.2980, A.6802-A)

Items.Title: CALL FOR STATED MEETING

Dear Council Members,

Please be advised that pursuant to Rule 1.00 of the Council, a Stated Meeting of the Council will take place on Monday, May 5, 2003 at 3:00 p.m.
Cordially,

Gifford Miller
Speaker
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Call for Stated Meeting - May 5, 2003

Items.Title: Resolution in support of the landmark Settlement Agreement in the case of Brad H. v. The City of New York, which provides mentally ill prison inmates with all the benefits of an adequate discharge plan prior to and/or immediately upon release from City prisons or jails, as mandated in Justice Richard Braun's 2000 ruling, which ruling was unanimously affirmed by the New York State Supreme Court, Appellate Division, First Department, and denied leave to appeal to the New York Court of Appeals.
Items.MatterName: Support of the proposed landmark Settlement Agreement in the case of Brad H. v. The City of New York.

VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk
